main_definition: Universal Product Code (UPC) is a barcode symbology used worldwide to identify retail products in stores.

meanings_and_examples.example: Each item in a store has a Unique Product Code (UPC) assigned to it for identification.
When scanning items at the checkout, the cashier uses a UPC scanner to read and process each product's barcode.
The black stripes on a packaged item represent its UPC-A barcode, which consists of 12 digits that identify the product.
Some retailers use UPC-E to print price information on items in a more compact and readable format compared to traditional barcodes.
